content.text:
# King Perryy

| birth_place       = Port Harcourt, Rivers State, Nigeria
| genre             = Afrofusion
| occupation        =
| instrument        = Keyboard
| years_active      = 2018present
| label             =
}}
Anthony Offiah (born 28 April 1997), professionally known as King Perryy, is a Nigerian afrofusion singer and songwriter. He gained popularity with the single "Man on Duty" featuring Timaya which was released in 2018 under Timaya's label DM Records.
Early life
Offiah was born on 28 April 1997 in Port Harcourt, Rivers State, Nigeria. He originally hails from Ezeagu, Enugu State. Nigeria. He attended primary and secondary school education in the Port Harcourt region and later received a degree in Project Management at the Federal University of Technology Owerri in  Imo State.
Career
In 2014, King Perryy released his debut single titled "Walakolombo" with guitar by Fiokee. He later got introduced to Timaya. In 2018, King Perryy was linked to Timaya’s Dem Mama records and they released their collaboration titled "Kom Kom" with Patoranking in December 2018.
In December 2019, he released his solo single "Work N Grind" which achieved remarkable success. He also released another single titled "Murder" featuring Teni which peaked at the top 10 MTV Base West Africa countdown.
On April 28, 2021, he released his debut studio album titled Citizen Of The World which features Phyno, Mayorkun, Kizz Daniel, Timaya, PsychoYP and Oxlade
He was nominated at the 2022 Ghana-Nigeria Music Awards Festival for Reggae Artist Of The Year. In 2022, he released a compilation project titled African Boy under his own label Continental Music.
He released his EP titled Continental Playlist in 2023 with guest features from Tekno, 1da Banton, Victony, and Ria Sean. In 2024, he released the singles "Confirm Parole" featuring Ajebo Hustlers and Dandizzy and "Gbege" featuring PsychoYP and Kaestyle. In the same year, he released an EP titled Niggas From The South.
Discography
Albums
*Citizen of the World (2021)
EP
*Continental Playlist (2023)
*Denge 6.0 (2024)
*Niggas From The South (2024)
